name: Mendelbase.jl
tagline: MendelBase contains the base functions of OpenMendel.
body: ### Overview [MendelBase](https://github.com/OpenMendel/MendelBase.jl) is a utility package that contains the base functions of [OpenMendel](https://openmendel.github.io). It provides the information needed to process keywords and read data from external files. MendelBase is necessary to run any analysis package, and you should install MendelBase first, before you install the other packages. ### Installation Within Julia, use the package manager to install MendelBase: Pkg.clone("git@github.com:OpenMendel/MendelBase.jl.git") This package supports Julia v0.4. ### Input Files To make your genetic data available to OpenMendel, the various input files must be in a format that OpenMendel can read. To provide OpenMendel with the information it needs to perform its analysis you must prepare the following files. Examples input files can be found in the docs subfolders of the different analysis packages. (An analysis option won't always need every file type.) * [Control File](#control-file): Specifies the names of your data input and output files and any optional parameters (*keywords*) for the analysis. (For a complete list of keywords, see [Keywords Table](#keywords-table) below). * [Locus File](#locus-file): Names and describes the genetic loci in your data. * [Pedigree File](#pedigree-file): Gives information about your individuals, such as name, sex, family structure, and ancestry. * [Phenotype File](#phenotype-file): Lists the available phenotypes. * [SNP Definition File](#snp-definition-file): Defines your SNPs with information such as SNP name, chromosome, position, allele names, allele frequencies. This may be a PLINK .bim format file. * [SNP Data File](#snp-data-file): Holds the genotypes for your data set. Must be a standard binary PLINK .bed file in SNP major format. If you have a SNP data file you must have a SNP definition file. ### Control files The format of the Control file is Keyword = Keyword_Value(s) Below is an example Control file to run GWAS (text after "#" is ignored and treated as comments): # # Input and Output files. # plink_input_basename = gwas 1 data output_file = gwas 1 Output.txt manhattan_plot_file = ManPlotOutput_1.png # # Analysis parameters for GWAS option. # regression = linear regression_formula = Trait ~ Sex In the example above, there are five keywords. The first three specify input and output files: *plink_input_basename*, *output_file*, *manhattan_plot_file*. The last two specify analysis parameters: *regression* and *regression_formula*. The text after the '=' are the keyword values. For keywords that can take a set of values, list the values separated by commas. ### Keywords This is a list of the general OpenMendel keywords common to most analysis package. The keywords specific to an analysis package are covered in detail in the documentation for each package. The names of keywords are *not* case sensitive. (The keyword *values* may be case sensitive.) Keyword | Default Value | Allowed Values | Short Description ---------------- | ---------------- | ---------------- | ---------------- affected_designator | affected | | Disease phenotype designator allele_pseudo_count | 0.1 | Real | Number of prior alleles or haplotypes allele_separator | / | 1 Character | Separates codominant alleles complexity_threshold | 5.00E+07 | Real | Criterion for not analyzing pedigrees disease_status | | | Name of column designating disease status distribution | Normal() | Binomial(), Gamma(), Normal(), or Poisson() | Name of distribution eliminate_genotypes | FALSE | TRUE, FALSE | Whether or not genotypes are eliminated female | "female", "f", 'f', "2", '2', 2 | Female designators separated by commas | Female designators field_separator | ',' | 1 Character | Character used to separates values in data files genetic_map_function | Haldane | Haldane or Kosambi | Genetic map units link | IdentityLink() | | Name of link function locus_file | | | Name of input locus file lump_alleles | FALSE | TRUE, FALSE | Whether or not alleles are combined male | "male", "m", 'm', "1", '1', 1 | Male designators separated by commas | Male designators new_pedigree_file | | | OpenMendel generated output pedigree file ordered_allele_separator | \| (vertical bar) | 1 Character | Separates ordered codominant alleles output_file | Mendel_Output.txt | | Name of standard results output file pedigree_file | | | Name of input pedigree file phenotype_file | | | Name of input phenotype file plink_input_basename | | | Basename of PLINK input files plink_output_basename | | | Basename of PLINK output files populations | | Names of populations separated by commas | Names of populations product_mode | TRUE | TRUE, FALSE | seed | 1234 | Integer | Random number generator seed snpdata_file | | | Name of input SNP data file snpdefinition_file | | | Name of input SNP definition_file ### General Data File Format All data files are in text file format with one exception: if you have dense SNP data, the SNP data should be in binary files in PLINK **.bed** file format. OpenMENDEL will also accept [PLINK format](http://pngu.mgh.harvard.edu/~purcell/plink/data.shtml) **.fam** and **.bim**. All non-PLINK OpenMendel data files list data in columns, with a header row with field names for each column. The column need not be in any fixed order. Many column headers have required, case sensitive names. The column separators can be any single character, specified in the control file with the **field_separator**. The the default separator is **comma**. If a data element contains the field separator (e.g. comma) it must be enclosed in double quotes, or it will be read as a new field. Missing data is blank ("") or "NA". The PLINK file missing data symbols are "0" or "-9". ### Locus File The Locus file defines your genetic markers unless you are working with a dense SNP map, in which case you must use a SNP Definition. The Locus file must have a header row with the field names (in any order): Locus, Allele, Chromosome, Frequency. If your samples come from different populations, instead of one column labeled Frequency, you may name the populations in the control file with the keyword *populations*, and give an allele frequency for each population. The population frequency field names are the population names specified in the control file. The population frequencies need not sum to 1, but will be normalized to 1 in the analysis. You may also include locus position information with optional fields **Morgans**, **FemaleMorgans** and **MaleMorgans**, and **Basepairs**. For each locus there will be one line per locus allele. **Example** Locus,Allele,Chromosome,European,African,Chinese ABO,A,9,0.27,0.18,0.19 ABO,B,9,0.06,0.11,0.17 ABO,O,9,NA,0.71,0.64 Rh,D,1,0.61,0.81,1 Rh,d,1,0.39,0.19,0 SNP,1,9,NA,NA,NA SNP,2,9,NA,NA,NA XSNP,1,X,0.3,0.4,0.5 XSNP,2,X,0.7,0.6,0.5 ### Pedigree File A Pedigree file is always required. It can be in PLINK FAM file format, in which case it must have the extension .fam, or it can have the format of a required header rows with the following fieldnames (in any order): Pedigree,Person,Mother,Father,Sex,Twin, and optional columns such as population ancestries. The fractional ancestries need not sum to 1, but will be normalized to 1 in the analysis. **Example** Pedigree,Person,Mother,Father,Sex,Twin,BirthYear,Politician,European,African,Chinese,ABO,Rh,Xg,XSNP,HtMeters Clinton,Bill,,,male,0,1946.0,true,1.0,0.0,0.0,A,+,+,2/2,1.88 Clinton,Hillary,,,female,0,1947.0,true,1.0,0.0,0.0,O,-,-,1/1,NA Clinton,Chelsea,Hillary,Bill,female,0,1980.0,false,NA,NA,NA,A,+,-,1/2,NA Obama,Barack,,,male,0,1961.0,true,0.5,0.5,0.0,O,+,NA,1/1,1.85 Obama,Michelle,,,female,0,1964.0,false,0.3,0.7,0.0,B,+,NA,2/2,NA Obama,Malia,Michelle,Barack,female,0,1998.0,false,NA,NA,NA,O,-,+,1/2,NA Obama,Sasha,Michelle,Barack,female,0,2001.0,false,NA,NA,NA,B,+,+,1/2,NA ### Phenotype File Format **Example** Locus,Phenotype,Genotypes ABO,A,"A/A,A/O" ABO,B,"B/B,B/O" ABO,AB,"A/B" ABO,O,"O/O" Rh,+,"D/D,D/d" Rh,-,"d/d" Xg,+,"+/+,+/-" Xg,-,"-/-" ###SNP Definition File Defines your SNPs with information such as SNP name, chromosome, position, allele names, allele frequencies. This may be a PLINK .bim format file. ###SNP Data File Holds the genotypes for your data set. Must be a standard binary PLINK .bed file in SNP major format. If you have a SNP data file you must have a SNP definition file. ### Citation If you use this analysis package in your research, please cite the following reference in the resulting publications: *Lange K, Papp JC, Sinsheimer JS, Sripracha R, Zhou H, Sobel EM (2013) Mendel: The Swiss army knife of genetic analysis programs. Bioinformatics 29:1568-1570.* ### Acknowledgments This project is supported by the National Institutes of Health under NIGMS awards R01GM053275 and R25GM103774 and NHGRI award R01HG006139.
